subject: Re: [junit] Re: Help with MockObjects
msgSnippet: ... But tearDown() has to run regardless of the success or failure of a test, so its behaviour should be kept separate. Actually, in a better world, there
messageBody:
Vincent Massol wrote:
>> That said, I always believed that the protocol says that setUp()
>> and teardown() should be for administration of the test and that
>> the business of the test should be done within the test* methods.
> Exactly! The verification of mock expectations is something generic
> and administrative... ;-)

But tearDown() has to run regardless of the success or failure of a
test, so its behaviour should be kept separate. Actually, in a better
world, there would be some kind of verify() step that would be called
after the run() but before the tearDown.

S.
